title: 820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
message: Hi, have this 820-3787-A Board which is completely dead no green light. PP3V42_G3H is 0V. My DC IN Board and genuine MagSafe Charger are known good. Aynone got a idea? I habe no idea on the history, just that it had a prior repair

title: 820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
message:
We always expect to get some voltages and signals in the first post; this helps a lot.
Check 3V42/PPBUS_G3H.

Be aware of FDMF6808 nightmare on these boards...

title: 820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
message:
You have some time on the forum.
So we expect to post more usefull information; is your interest to gain time...

Didn't check if any short?
Some basic voltages for U7100?

title: 820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
message: Sorry for the lack of information, I’ve just never had this exact issue and was quite frankly a bit confused about everything being 0V.... Measured all pins on U7100 and all are 0v...

title: 820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
message:
Looks like input leakage.
We still need more tests and measurments...

Did you try fake charger, or lab power supply?
Post exact R7012 value; ohm scale, onboard.
Same for R7180/81 and R7185/86.
Check if D7010 is not open, or shorted.
Post Q7010 voltages too.

title: 820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
message: Have no fake chargers around here. In order to power with a DC Power Supply do I have to chop up a irking MagSafe 2 Charger?

title: 820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
message:
You will need Magsafe 2 85W cable, which can power any board.

What about the other indiciouses I gave you???

title: 820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
message: Oh sorry I thought I posted those too guess I accidentally deleted the post instead of posting it or something like that...  But tbh I don't think the other Voltages will be required. Upon plugging in the Charger with the DC Supply it went green and then orange before literally burning a hole in the board... The connector was already removed by another shop before...Have a look at this mess.... Is there a chance of salvaging it?

title: 820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
message:
Is that LCD connector area?
You can try to clean any burning sign there.
Then check for any short...

title: 820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
message: Yup it sure is. There must be some massive short here because the power supply output is dragged down to about 5v with a current draw of the maximum 5A.... Cleaning it did nothing it still smokes like crazy whenever I apply power. Also no more green light...

title: 820-3787-A completely dead no green light PP3V42_G3H 0V
message: This one will be tough I already know that... I hope I can at least fix that A1425 one more easily...
